issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Tile views on landing pages still need sorting control, even though that's gone for tables which are now sortable.

Values should be sort by:

Resource name (A-Z) <--default sort
Resource name (Z-A)
Metric name (A-Z)
Metric name (Z-A)
fields.summary: missing sorting order on metrics landing page, tile view

comments.body: This has been fixed in GUI-2411 branch.
There's no default sort when I first enter the view. This might be causing a bunch of issues, like the rogue tile is back, and things are out of order. I'll UX review GUI-2411 once this is fixed.

I set the default sort order to res name (that wasn't right).
I cleared local storage on chrome and it properly showed the default sort and I didn't see any rogue tile.
Still not working on chrome. Screenshot attached.
Dumped local storage, problem persists on chrome.
We're going to need to screen-share, [~jloza]. I just can't reproduce your problem anymore (chrome or ff)
UX review passed, ready for code review.

[~dkavanagh]: Sorting by resource name doesn't appear to work in the tile view or table view on the metrics landing page.  When I sort by Resource name A to Z, the per-instance metrics display 'kg-instance2' before 'aaa-instance1' (see screenshots).

It looks to me like it's sorting by instance id, not name, judging by the screenshots.
Challenging because the resource names are lazy loaded.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/2008

[~jloza], the problem on this page is that names are lazy loaded. So, initial sort cannot use the names. Should we re-sort the page once names are lazy loaded? While the initial view may not be right, it seems that adjusting the sort a couple seconds after the table or tiles are shown might be weird for users.
we should handle this how we handle it on the instance landing page, the same problem should be there too, right?
No, instance landing doesn't lazy load names. Names come w/ the resources on other landing page. This page is different because metrics just have IDs not names, so we lazy load those.
-The fix does not work on Firefox.-
[~dmitrii]: Sorry, I was confused by this during the bug scrub, mistaking it for another ticket (GUI-2503).  I think [~dkavanagh] is  still working on this AFAICT.

[~dmitrii]: As a follow-up to the confusion w.r.t. this ticket, I restored 4.3.0 as the fix version.  Feel free to punt it to 4.3.1 if you feel it isn't critical enough for 4.3.0, although [~dkavanagh] has already mostly implemented a fix for this, and the latest PR (https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/2008) includes a minor fix for resource name sorting on the metrics landing page.
Can now sort by resource name metrics landing page.
